column1: File:Ted Nasmith - Dimrill Dale.jpg - Dimrill Dale
Dimrill Dale (Nanduhirion in Sindarin and Azanulbizar in Khuzdul) was a valley on the east side of the Misty Mountains
column4: and Fanuidhol peaks. It was the eastern end of Redhorn Pass and was bordered by the Dimrill Stair. Dimrill Dale was the source of the Celebrant river. At its southeast corner was Mirrormere
column5: a sacred lake to the Dwarves of Durins Folk.

column1: During the Years of the Trees
column2: Durin wandered south to Dimrill Dale and founded the Kingdom of Moria beneath the surrounding mountains. Thousands of years later
column3: after Orcs had turned the Dwarven city into the "Black Pit" of Moria
column4: the climactic battle of the War of the Dwarves and Orcs was fought here. The Battle of Azanulbizar
column6: ended as a defeat of the Orcs and their leader Azog. The Dwarves
column8: were unable to take back Moria because of the Durins Bane that still dwelt there.

column1: The Fellowship of the Ring briefly rested in Dimrill Dale after escaping from Moria
The name Dimrill means "overshadowed rills" referring to the rills that ran down the mountain-side.
